text: "Ghosts Again" is a song by Depeche Mode, an English electronic band. It was released on 9 February 2023. It is the lead single from their fifteenth studio album, Memento Mori. ==Background== The song is the first single release since co-founder and keyboardist Andy Fletcher died in May 2022. Dave Gahan said the song "captures this perfect balance of melancholy and joy". Martin Gore added that the song has "such an upbeat feel to it" and how rare it is for the band to record a song that "I just don't get sick of listening to". ==Remixes== Remixes of the song were released in May 2023, by artists including Chris Liebing, Luke Slater, Rival Consoles, Matthew Herbert and Davide Rossi. == Track listing == ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== Weekly chart performance for "Ghosts Again" Chart (2023) Peak position Latvia Airplay (LAIPA) 6 Poland (Polish Airplay Top 100) 22 San Marino (SMRRTV Top 50) 11 Sweden Heatseeker (Sverigetopplistan) 16 UK Singles Sales (OCC) 14 ===Year-end charts=== Year-end chart performance for "Ghosts Again" Chart (2023) Position US Hot Dance/Electronic Songs (Billboard) 49 US Rock Airplay (Billboard) 47 ==References== Category:2023 songs Category:Depeche Mode songs Category:Synth-pop songs
